text: [Music]
my name is Tim Ramsey and I work at
ziplist I'm the Chief Architect there
and I'm one of the founders ziplist is
an online recipe box and shopping list
Tool uh we have both web and a mobile
versions of those things allowing users
to add it items to their shopping list
organize recipes and recipe boxes and uh
to add recipe ingredients to shopping
their shopping list when ziplist first
started out we uh started out pretty
much with the cloud in mind we we never
had any intention of Hosting our own
hardware and and managing our own
Hardware infrastructure our very first
appointment was on a cloud provider that
was not Amazon web services but we very
quick switched uh to Amazon web services
zipas uses ec2 for our application and
API servers those servers are running a
traditional Ruby on Rails kind of Stack
there and uh we put those servers behind
an elastic load balancer so we get great
performance uh out of our systems at the
back end we use uh RDS we use uh S3 also
for mostly archival purposes some of our
static assets are served off of
cloudfront uh which are use S3 our
searching solution we use cloud search
for uh both searching our Global recipe
index as well as the re user recipe
boxes Cloud search is used for both of
those Cloud search provides out of the
box those kinds of those kinds of great
features the filtering and fating that
you the user experiences and once again
that experience is consistent across our
globe recipe index versus the recipe box
index before we were using Cloud search
we had one of our popular search Pages
took about 8 to 9 seconds to render
after we switched to Cloud search that
same page took about 1 second or less to
render our users search for recipes or
they're organizing their recipe box and
they want to see their recipes in a
particular way search is a Lynch pin for
all of those kinds of activities Cloud
search gives us great user experience
from the point of view of speed as well
as features AWS has enabled ziplist to
scale from our small starting out at
1,000 users and a
small uh ec2 instance all the way up to
three and a half million users which is
where we are today and million and a
half recipes and in our Global index and
over 24 million recipes in our uh in
recipe box boxes
[Music]
